column3: Pirak is an archaeological site belonging to the Indus Valley Civilization located in Balochistan
column4: Pakistan. It is 20 km south of Sibi east of the Nari River. The mound is 8m high and covers approximately 12 acres (49
column5: 000 m2). The site of Pirak was first reported by Robert Raikes in 1963. It was excavated
column7: before the well known sites of Mehrgarh or Nausharo by the French archaeological mission team led by Jean Marie Casal. According to the excavator
column8: this site was occupied from c.1800 BCE to 800 BCE.
